class wp4.compare.models.donor.Donor(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Extension of an OrganPerson record (via OneToOne link for good ORM/DB management) to capture the Donor specific data

Also holds the meta-data specific to the Procurement Form

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • person_id (django.db.models.OneToOneField) – “person” - Internal link to OrganPerson
  • sequence_number (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “sequence number” - Internal value for tracking trial ID sequence number. Value of 1-99

person¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

NON_RANDOMISATION_CHOICES = ((0, <django.utils.functional.__proxy__ object at 0x10d4b3450>), (1, <django.utils.functional.__proxy__ object at 0x10d4b3490>), (2, <django.utils.functional.__proxy__ object at 0x10d4b34d0>), (3, <django.utils.functional.__proxy__ object at 0x10d4b3510>), (4, <django.utils.functional.__proxy__ object at 0x10d4b3550>), (5, <django.utils.functional.__proxy__ object at 0x10d4b3590>))¶

Choices limited to staff with StaffJob.TRANSPLANT_COORDINATOR set

Donor systemic_flush_used choices

systolic_pressure_low = None¶

< 50 mm Hg (inadequate organ perfusion)

circulatory_arrest = None¶

Also known as the start of no touch period

death_diagnosed = None¶

Changes to this require sync to the OrganPerson.date_of_death, see the save method

systemic_flush_volume_used = None¶

NB – this doesn’t appear on the paper forms

heparin = None¶

As administered to donor/in flush solution

clean()[source]¶

Clears the following fields of data if their corresponding unknown flag is set to True

  • call_received
  • scheduled_start
  • technician_arrival
  • ice_boxes_filled
  • depart_perfusion_centre
  • arrival_at_donor_hospital
  • date_of_admission
  • date_admitted_to_itu
  • diuresis_last_day
  • diuresis_last_hour
  • systolic_pressure_low
  • o2_saturation
  • circulatory_arrest
  • perfusion_started

Error if:

  • arrival_at_donor_hospital before depart_perfusion_centre (DOv01)
  • age does not match person.age_from_dob (DOv05)
  • date_of_birth is less than 50 years before date_of_procurement (DOv03)
  • date_of_birth is more than 100 years before date_of_procurement (DOv04)
  • date_of_procurement before date_of_admission (DOv06)
  • admitted_to_itu without recording date_admitted_to_itu (DOv07)
  • diagnosis is set to Other, and diagnosis_other is empty (DOv08)
  • date_admitted_to_itu before date_of_admission (DOv12)
  • life_support_withdrawal before date_of_admission (DOv09)
  • circulatory_arrest after death_diagnosed (DOv10) - a pre-requisite for DCD case eligibility
  • systemic_flush_used is set to Other, but systemic_flush_used_other is empty (DOv11)
  • procurement_form_completed is True, but: retrieval_hospital is not set (DOv12); and person.number is empty (DOv13)
save(created_by=None, force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)[source]¶

Updated save method to ensure that if death_diagnosed is set, then this is reflected in the same value for person.date_of_death

Parameters:
  • created_by – User. As parent method
  • force_insert – bool. As parent method
  • force_update – bool. As parent method
  • using – As parent method
  • update_fields – As parent method
Returns:

super(Donor, self).save()
randomise(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Randomise if eligible and not already done. This is determined by looking at the elibility criteria, and checking that the Organ.preservation is not set. Once randomised, the sequence_number is allocated for the Trial ID to be defined. The location of the retrieval_team is used to determine which geographical list set to use, and the is_online value determines which of the two lists to pick from.

Parameters:is_online – bool. Pick from an online list if True, or an Offline list if False
Returns:True if randomisation occurs, False otherwise
Return type:bool
left_kidney¶

Property to emulate a safe get_or_create call to Organ. If no linked organ, a new record is created with sensible defaults and linked.

Returns:Organ record for the left kidney
Return type:wp4.compare.models.organ.Organ
right_kidney¶

Property to emulate a safe get_or_create call to Organ. If no linked organ, a new record is created with sensible defaults and linked.

Returns:Organ record for the right kidney
Return type:wp4.compare.models.organ.Organ
centre_code¶

Does a safe lookup for the centre_code of the retrieval_team. If no team set, returns 0

Returns:Centre code, or 0
Return type:int
trial_id¶

Returns the composite trial id string.

Returns:‘WP4cctnns’ - where:
  • cc = 2 digit centre code
  • t = single digit, 0 for online, 9 for offline randomisation
  • nn = 2 digit sequence number, starting at 01
  • s = (optional) single character denoting organ location, L for Left, R for Right

If no centre_code set or a lack of sequence_number, returns “No Trial ID Assigned (DOnnn)” where nnn = the object’s ID
Return type:str
is_offline¶

Determine if this was randomised using the relevant online or offline lists

Returns:True, if randomisation.list_code matches PAPER_EUROPE or PAPER_UNITED_KINGDOM
Return type:bool
is_randomised¶

Checks the left_kidney.preservation value, and if PRESERVATION_NOT_SET, returns False.

Returns:True if the left kidney has been randomised
Return type:bool
is_eligible¶

Number of eligible kidneys from this donor.

Returns:0, 1, or 2 kidneys, and -1 for not randomised
Return type:int

Donor.organ_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Donor.randomisation¶

Accessor to the related object on the reverse side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class wp4.compare.models.donor.Randomisation(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Populated from the supplied CSV file via the fixture. A ‘True’ result is HMP+O2 for the Left Organ

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • donor_id (django.db.models.OneToOneField) – “donor” - Internal link to the Donor
  • list_code (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “RA01 list code”
  • result (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “RA02 result”
  • allocated_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “RA03 allocated on”

list_code = None¶

Choices limited to LIST_CHOICES

static get_and_assign_result(list_code, link_donor)[source]¶

Finds the next unassigned record on the randomisation list, and then assigns it to the Donor record supplied, whilst returning the result

Parameters:
  • list_code – int. Value from LIST_CHOICES
  • link_donor – Donor object. Donor record to link against this randomisation
Returns:

‘True’ result is HMP+O2 for the Left Organ
Return type:

bool
